intro: Savignya parviflora, commonly known as the small-flowered savignya, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments.
